author: Andrew Beckford
title: Rimac Teases Liquid-Fueled Nanotubes to Replace Heavy EV Batteries
text:
The story of Mate Rimac is the stuff of legend. He started as a track day enthusiast who just wanted to make his electric-converted BMW E30 go faster, and then faster. That quest started him down a path that led to his name lending itself to the current fastest production EV supercar in the world â€”both going forward and backwardsâ€”and then being tapped to helm the iconic Bugatti brand since 2021 . Despite that success, Rimac (the guy) is not resting on his laurels, and the visionary has been having some more visions lately.
In an interview with Autocar (via Autoblog ) , the Bugatti and Rimac CEO discussed the future of the brands and some of the new technologies they are exploring: "Rimac isn't exclusively electric," said the CEO. "It's doing whatever is the most exciting at the time."
He revealed that the automaker is experimenting with so-called nanotube material technology to see if it can function as a viable source of electricity to propel a vehicle drivetrain one day, as a sort of engine. The tech seems to work by superheating unique liquid fuels which form a thin coating over "hollow tubes made of a lattice of carbon atoms, which have unique electrical properties," according to one MIT method (Rimac's approach could be different, he didn't detail it in the interview).
If this method works properly at a larger scale than tested so far, it could potentially replace the heavy battery packs we see in EVs today as an alternative fuel source to existing electric and hydrogen car designs. Rimac mentions liquefied petroleum gas, hydrogen, and diesel as potential sorts of fuels to be used for this admittedly novel method of generating electricity. The automaker has linked up with a startup that's now experimenting with nanotubes operating at 80 percent fuel efficiency on a small scale (if it scales up, that would be more than twice as efficient as traditional gas engines).
The downside is that this method still produces CO2, so it wouldn't line up with the "zero" emissions goals that many automakers and governments are currently proposing, despite the efficiency advantage over fueled engines we currently have. It would take some impressive technology and serious political reconsideration to make it appeal to the mass market, but for a smaller-volume model like a six- or seven-figure sports car, it could be feasible.
If Rimac can make headway with nanotube technology and ditch battery packs in its supercars, it would potentially save a literal half-ton of weight but retain all of the attractive potential power and torque of an EV. However, the Rimac Nevera succeeds despite weighing 5,000 pounds, and can still reach a top speed of 258 mph ; now just imagine what it could do if it was 1,000-pounds lighter?
We could be a few short years away from EV supercars with top speeds well over 300 mph, if tire technology can keep up and there's a straight piece of road long enough to even test it. If anyone's going to develop a car to do it, it's going to be him. But should it be branded as a Rimac, or a Bugatti? It seems like a Rimac thing, for now.

author: Anonym
title: Flood situation in Germany could worsen: DWD makes threatening rain forecast - The Limited Times
text:
Last updated: 29.12.2023, 09:52 a.m.
By: Jennifer Lanzinger
CommentsPrint Share
For days, numerous regions in Germany have been struggling with the floods. The situation remains tense, the DWD fears further rain. The news ticker.
Munich/Dresden â€“ On Friday, the situation in numerous flood areas in Germany remains threatening. The situation could deteriorate further, with the German Weather Service predicting some heavy rainfall. The situation continues to be particularly tense in Lower Saxony. There, emergency services now even have to rescue animals from the Serengeti Park. Fire brigades are also in continuous operation in many places in eastern Germany.
The rainy weather that has now been announced could significantly exacerbate the situation in the affected areas. In the reservoirs of the Bergisches Land and the Siegerland in North Rhine-Westphalia as well as the Harz Mountains, continuous rain must be expected from Friday morning until the night to Saturday. Up to 40 liters per square meter could fall within 24 hours.
Lower Saxony continues to be severely affected by floods â€“ evacuations prepared In Lower Saxony, areas along the rivers Aller, Leine and Weser in the southern and central parts of the state are affected. There, the situation worsened further on Thursday. The dikes were no longer able to withstand the masses of water everywhere. Thousands of relief workers are deployed across the country. Evacuations were prepared in some places. In the municipality of Langlingen in the district of Celle, about 120 people left their houses and apartments as a precaution on Friday night. On Friday morning, the state government wants to give an update on the flood situation at a press conference.
Prime Minister Stephan Weil (SPD) said on Thursday that there had never been a flood of this magnitude before. "Experts have long warned that the increasing frequency of weather extremes is linked to climate change," he said. According to the Ministry of the Interior, a so-called extraordinary event was detected in six districts as well as the city of Oldenburg. With this measure, for example, counties can more easily access auxiliary staff.
Flood situation is also causing problems in Bremen â€“ numerous residents have left their homes There is also no all-clear yet around Bremen. According to the authorities on Thursday evening, numerous houses along the WÃ¼mme in the Katrepel area are surrounded by water and without electricity. Most of the residents have left this area. In the district of Timmersloh, the water is standing on the dikes. Roads and fields are flooded. According to the information provided by the Interior Ministry, measures to secure the dike have already had to be carried out several times.
Flood situation: No all-clear yet in Dresden either On the Elbe in Dresden, rising water levels are expected. Early Thursday afternoon, 5.92 meters were measured. This was still just below the six-metre mark from which the second-highest alert level 3 would apply. The state flood control center expected this limit to be exceeded on Friday morning - but only very slightly with a maximum of 6.01 meters. A normal water level of 2.00 meters in the Elbe in the state capital is normal.

The hydrologists expected a decrease in the Elbe flood water from Friday, as a spokesman for the State Office for the Environment, Agriculture and Geology said. Only locally light rain is expected, in the Czech catchment area of the Elbe neither precipitation nor snowmelt until Friday.
Downstream in Magdeburg and SchÃ¶nebeck in Saxony-Anhalt, the State Agency for Flood Protection and Water Management opened the Pretzien weir on Thursday. This means that about a third of the Elbe's water is channelled past the two cities through a flood channel and across meadows and fields before flowing back into the Elbe.
Emergency services drain water from Kelbra dam In the north of Thuringia, the focus is on the Kelbra dam, from which water has been drained. In the village of MÃ¶nchpfiffel-Nikolausrieth, there was therefore a threat that about 30 houses would be flooded, as a spokesman for the Ministry of the Interior announced on Thursday. Emergency services had set up 6000,<> sandbags on the riverbank to prevent this. According to the information, the water was about ten centimeters below the edge of the bank.

La explicaciÃ³n cientÃ­fica de la Aemet
Las auroras aparecen por la interacciÃ³n entre el viento solar y el campo magnÃ©tico de la Tierra, segÃºn la Aemet. "El viento solar es mÃ¡s fuerte en momentos cercanos a la mÃ¡xima actividad solar, que se produce en ciclos de entre 10 y 12 aÃ±os", explican.
MeteorologÃ­a ha informado que actualmente estamos cerca del mÃ¡ximo de actividad solar: las manchas solares indican las zonas de actividad magnÃ©tica solar asociada con erupciones solares atmosfÃ©ricas y eyecciones de masa coronal.
Las auroras polares se deben a la presencia de partÃ­culas cargadas elÃ©ctricamente y eyectadas desde el sol (el viento solar), que actÃºan sobre los gases enrarecidos de las capas superiores de la atmÃ³sfera, de acuerdo con la OrganizaciÃ³n MeteorolÃ³gica Mundial.
El campo magnÃ©tico de la Tierra canaliza las partÃ­culas, principalmente electrones y protones, que colisionan con los Ã¡tomos y molÃ©culas de los gases de las capas superiores de la atmÃ³sfera (termosfera y exosfera).
Esas colisiones provocan que los electrones de los Ã¡tomos de nitrÃ³geno y de oxÃ­geno asciendan temporalmente a un estado energÃ©tico superior, "excitado", segÃºn la Aemet. Al recuperarse los niveles de energÃ­a normales, se libera energÃ­a que se emite en forma de fotones de luz con distintas longitudes de onda.
Las auroras polares se observan principalmente en arcos prÃ³ximos a los polos magnÃ©ticos (los Ã³valos aurorales).
Algo muy poco habitual
Pero si la actividad solar es muy intensa, como actualmente, las eyecciones de masa coronal o erupciones solares atmosfÃ©ricas pueden intensificar el viento solar y alcanzar la magnetosfera de la Tierra, desencadenando una tormenta geomagnÃ©tica.
Durante estos fenÃ³menos, el Ã³valo auroral se ensancha temporalmente, lo que permite percibir auroras desde latitudes mÃ¡s bajas. "Eso es lo que estÃ¡ ocurriendo esta noche: las tormentas geomagnÃ©ticas severas de las Ãºltimas horas permiten observar auroras boreales (asÃ­ se llaman las auroras polares del hemisferio norte) desde EspaÃ±a, algo muy poco habitual", ha informado la Aemet.

text:

Com a resoluÃ§Ã£o 193 da ComissÃ£o de Valores MobiliÃ¡rios (CVM) em 2023, o paÃ­s passou a ser o primeiro no mundo a exigir a adoÃ§Ã£o de normas internacionais definidas pelo International Sustainability Standards Board (ISSB), da IFRS Foundation.

Ele defende que, mais do que na implementaÃ§Ã£o do ISSB, o paÃ­s tambÃ©m tem potencial para se sobressair na pauta de descarbonizaÃ§Ã£o.
O ISSB estabelece um conjunto de critÃ©rios para relatÃ³rios de sustentabilidade e tem como objetivo padronizar e garantir maior transparÃªncia na divulgaÃ§Ã£o de dados de carÃ¡ter ESG por parte das companhias. â€œCom isso, todo mundo ganha: os investidores, as empresas, a sociedadeâ€, comenta o superintendente.
De acordo com uma
pesquisa
divulgada em abril pela PwC Brasil, a maior parte das empresas estÃ¡ em fase de entendimento das normas. Quase 60% ainda nÃ£o definiram os papÃ©is e as responsabilidades para a preparaÃ§Ã£o das divulgaÃ§Ãµes relacionadas Ã  sustentabilidade.
Sanches explica que a expectativa nÃ£o Ã© que as organizaÃ§Ãµes apresentem um relatÃ³rio perfeito logo no primeiro ano de adoÃ§Ã£o. â€œTudo isso Ã© uma construÃ§Ã£o. O importante Ã© iniciar esse trabalho e fazer o melhor possÃ­vel.â€
IntegraÃ§Ã£o com GRI e outros padrÃµes
A IFRS Foundation anunciou no Ãºltimo mÃªs algumas mudanÃ§as nos padrÃµes do ISSB, a fim de promover maior objetividade e consistÃªncia nos relatÃ³rios de sustentabilidade.
A fundaÃ§Ã£o disse que vai buscar integrar de forma mais efetiva as normas ISSB com parÃ¢metros definidos por outros Ã³rgÃ£os, como o Transition Plan Taskforce, GHG Protocol (Protocolo de Gases de Efeito Estufa, GEE), Carbon Disclosure Project (CDP), Taskforce on Nature-Related Financial Disclosures (TNFD) e Global Reporting Initiative (GRI), o principal padrÃ£o utilizado pelas empresas para a criaÃ§Ã£o de relatÃ³rios de sustentabilidade corporativa.
Segundo o ISSB, mais de 20 jurisdiÃ§Ãµes (paÃ­ses ou regiÃµes) jÃ¡ decidiram usar ou estÃ£o tomando medidas para introduzir esses padrÃµes em seus quadros legais ou regulatÃ³rios. Juntas, elas representam quase 55% do produto interno bruto (PIB) global e mais de 40% da capitalizaÃ§Ã£o de mercado global.
DivulgaÃ§Ã£o de relatÃ³rios baseados no ISSB ainda Ã© facultativa
A resoluÃ§Ã£o 193 da ComissÃ£o de Valores MobiliÃ¡rios (CVM), publicada no final do ano passado, tornou a divulgaÃ§Ã£o de informaÃ§Ãµes relacionadas a prÃ¡ticas ESG facultativa a partir de 2024 e obrigatÃ³ria a partir de 2026 por empresas de capital aberto.

â€œOrientaÃ§Ã£o da CVM Ã© um grande passo em prol de um mercado de capitais mais sustentÃ¡velâ€, diz especialista
Na visÃ£o do profissional da B3, a CVM 193 foi uma boa estratÃ©gia adotada pelo Brasil. â€œIsso vai colocar a gente na lideranÃ§a. Vai manter, na verdade, porque jÃ¡ estamos na lideranÃ§a nesta frente.â€
Ele explica que Ã© um processo novo para as empresas, que estÃ£o acostumadas a olhar e pensar nesses dados no passado. A implementaÃ§Ã£o das normas ISSB foi um dos temas abordados por Sanches e outros palestrantes durante a Febraban Tech 2024, realizada na semana passada em SÃ£o Paulo. â€œQuando olhamos para o futuro, nÃ£o Ã© tentando prever, mas exercitar alguns cenÃ¡rios para construir estratÃ©gias para uma organizaÃ§Ã£o mais resiliente e um futuro mais justo.â€
ImportÃ¢ncia e desafios na adoÃ§Ã£o de normas de sustentabilidade pelas empresas
Segundo o levantamento da PwC, os principais desafios das companhias na adoÃ§Ã£o de normas de sustentabilidade estÃ£o relacionados Ã  integraÃ§Ã£o entre as Ã¡reas da organizaÃ§Ã£o que atuam em diferentes frentes, Ã  preparaÃ§Ã£o das informaÃ§Ãµes quantitativas sobre os riscos e as oportunidades relacionados Ã  sustentabilidade. Outro problema observado foi a necessidade de publicar as informaÃ§Ãµes sobre sustentabilidade na mesma data que as demonstraÃ§Ãµes financeiras.
Para Sanches, alÃ©m da dificuldade de coleta e compreensÃ£o da materialidade dos dados, existe a questÃ£o das emissÃµes financiadas (escopo 3) â€“ emissÃµes indiretas e que dizem respeito Ã  atividade do restante da cadeia de trabalho.
â€œExiste todo um esforÃ§o para ajudar os atores de mercado a conseguirem um melhor reporting , com mais transparÃªncia, acesso Ã  informaÃ§Ã£o, oportunidades de investimento, e reduzindo riscos relacionados a greenwashing â€, comenta. Como consequÃªncia, a empresa pode ter ganhos de reputaÃ§Ã£o e interoperabilidade, ajudando a tornar-se mais competitiva, inovadora, e eficiente em sua gestÃ£o.
â€œEu encaro [a adoÃ§Ã£o de normas] nÃ£o como uma carga extra, mas como uma oportunidade de ser mais vocal, de levar essa informaÃ§Ã£o para investidores em todo o mundo e mostrar que fazemos um trabalho excelente e somos lÃ­deres nissoâ€, enfatiza o superintendente da B3.

title: Paycom Nationally Recognized for Positive Workplace Culture, Outstanding Benefits | PAYC Stock News
text:
Paycom Nationally Recognized for Positive Workplace Culture, Outstanding Benefits
Paycom Software, Inc. (NYSE: PAYC) has been recognized for its positive workplace culture and outstanding benefits by employee review platform Comparably. The company ranked No. 5 among large companies for both happiest employees and best perks & benefits in the U.S. and Canada. Paycom was also listed for best work-life balance.
Paycom offers generous benefits including $1-per-pay-period individual health insurance, 401(k) with generous matching, paid family leave, and pet insurance. The company's founder, CEO, and chairman, Chad Richison, emphasized their focus on creating the best employee experience.
Comparably Awards are based on anonymous employee feedback over a 12-month period. Paycom has previously earned accolades for Best Company for Career Growth, Best Company Leadership, Best Company Outlook, and Best Sales Team.

Paycom Software, Inc. (NYSE: PAYC) (â€œPaycomâ€), a leading provider of comprehensive, cloud-based human capital management software, was recognized for its workplace culture from employee review and salary platform Comparably.
Paycom ranked at No. 5 among large companies with the happiest employees in the
â€œItâ€™s an honor to receive these recognitions because they came directly from our employees,â€ said Chad Richison, Paycom founder, CEO and chairman. â€œWeâ€™re focused on creating the best employee experience for companies around the world through our software, and thatâ€™s no different for our own employees.â€
Paycom offers generous benefits to its employees, including
Comparably Awards are based on sentiment feedback from current employees who anonymously rated their employers on Comparablyâ€™s website during a 12-month period. Recognized companies were determined by the following criteria:
- Happiest Employees: feedback on factors that contribute to happiness at work, including positive environment, fair pay, great benefits and more
- Best Perks & Benefits: feedback on perks, paid time off and benefit satisfaction
- Best Work-Life Balance: feedback on work-life balance, average hours worked per day, lunch breaks, time off and more
A Paycom employee from the finance department spoke highly of Paycomâ€™s culture in a Comparably review, writing, â€œIâ€™m happy knowing the work I do makes a difference in this growing company, but most importantly, the friendships I have made [at Paycom] make my job very enjoyable.â€
Paycom earned additional accolades from Comparably earlier this year, including
Best Company for Career Growth, Best Company Leadership, Best Company Outlook and Best Sales Team.
